result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis R Leggett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Payment plan erased and recreated to reflect adjusted cycle due date according to payments received.  Payment plan created on 12/13/16, court ordered $100/monthly starting 1/1/17.  at
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this OWIPP.

Court GRANTS the Defendant's request to extend the time to pay the fine, costs and surcharges at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing on 10-01-2016 until paid in full. Order received, signed, and filed with the court.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jean Kies, Br. 45, calendar successor, for review. spc
payment plan request
from Dr. Jens, Deptartment of Veterans Affairs, received and filed.

Defendant Dennis R Leggett in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court ordered stayed warrant lifted. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNT 2:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37. Court ordered DNA sample. Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. For reasons stated on the record as to the defendant is at VA Hospital,   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Calendar call scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis R Leggett in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time needed.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.

Defendant Dennis R Leggett in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/22/15 @ 1:30pm
